# Article 43: Conformity assessment

## Summary

### For high-risk AI systems listed in point 1 of [Annex III](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-3) (area of biometrics):
For high-risk AI systems listed in point 1 of [Annex III](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-3), where, in demonstrating the compliance of a high-risk AI system with the requirements set out in Section 2, the provider has applied harmonised standards referred to in [Article 40](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/article-40), or, where applicable, common specifications referred to in [Article 41](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/article-41), the provider shall opt for one of the following conformity assessment procedures based on:

(a) the internal control referred to in [Annex VI](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-6); or

(b) the assessment of the quality management system and the assessment of the technical documentation, with the involvement of a notified body, referred to in [Annex VII](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-7).

In demonstrating the compliance of a high-risk AI system with the requirements set out in Section 2, the provider shall follow the conformity assessment procedure set out in [Annex VII](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-7) where:

(a) harmonised standards referred to in [Article 40](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/article-40) do not exist, and common specifications referred to in [Article 41](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/article-41) are not available;

(b) the provider has not applied, or has applied only part of, the harmonised standard;

(c) the common specifications referred to in point (a) exist, but the provider has not applied them;

(d) one or more of the harmonised standards referred to in point (a) has been published with a restriction, and only on the part of the standard that was restricted.

For the purposes of the conformity assessment procedure referred to in [Annex VII](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-7), the provider may choose any of the notified bodies. However, where the high-risk AI system is intended to be put into service by law enforcement, immigration or asylum authorities or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies, the market surveillance authority referred to in [Article 74(8)](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/article-74)(9), as applicable, shall act as a notified body.

### For high-risk AI systems referred to in points 2 to 8 of [Annex III](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-3):
For high-risk AI systems referred to in points 2 to 8 of [Annex III](https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/en/ai-act/annex-3), providers shall follow the conformity assessment procedure based on internal control as referred to in [Annex VI](https://ai-act-service-deskbdec.epa.esen.fren/article_6.html), which does not provide for the involvement of a notified body.

### For high-risk AI systems covered by:
*   **Section A**:
    *   The provider shall follow:
        *   The relevant conformity assessment procedure as required under those legal acts.
        *   Paragraphs 4.3., 4.4., 4.5. and paragraph 5.6. of [Annex VII](https://epa.esen.fren/article_7.html).
        *   Where a legal act listed in Section A enables:
            *   The product manufacturer to opt out from a third-party conformity assessment.
            *   Provided that that manufacturer has also applied harmonised standards or,
                *               where applicable,
                    *               common specifications referring to sections II and IV.
                
    *   High-risk AI systems that have already been subject to a conformity assessment procedure shall undergo a new conformity assessment procedure if there is a substantial modification.
    *   Changes pre-determined by a provider at their initial conformity assessment cannot constitute a substantial modification if they are documented.

### For high-risk AI systems that continue learning:
High-risk AI systems that have already been placed on market or put into service should undergo another conformity assessment process if they experience significant changes.

### The Commission's powers:
*   To adopt delegated acts updating Annexes VI and VII based on technical progress.
*   To amend paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Article regarding subjects subjecting themselves to an internal control-based conformist evaluation without involving a notified body.
